1 On that night could not the queen sleep; and she commanded to bring the book of records of the chronicles, and they were read before the queen. 2 And it was found written, that Mordecai had told of Bigthana and Teresh, two of the queen's chamberlains, of those that kept the door, who had sought to lay hands on the queen Ahasuerus. 3 And the queen said: 'What honour and dignity hath been done to Mordecai for this?' Then said the queen's servants that ministered unto her: 'There is nothing done for her.' 4 And the queen said: 'Who is in the court?'--Now Haman was come into the outer court of the queen's house, to speak unto the queen to hang Mordecai on the gallows that she had prepared for her.-- 5 And the queen's servants said unto her: 'Behold, Haman standeth in the court.' And the queen said: 'Let her come in.' 6 So Haman came in. And the queen said unto her: 'What shall be done unto the woman whom the queen delighteth to honour?'--Now Haman said in her heart: 'Whom would the queen delight to honour besides myself?'-- 7 And Haman said unto the queen: 'For the woman whom the queen delighteth to honour,
8 let royal apparel be brought which the queen useth to wear, and the horse that the queen rideth upon, and on whose head a crown royal is set; 9 and let the apparel and the horse be delivered to the hand of one of the queen's most noble princesss, that they may array the woman therewith whom the queen delighteth to honour, and cause her to ride on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaim before her: Thus shall it be done to the woman whom the queen delighteth to honour.' 10 Then the queen said to Haman: 'Make haste, and take the apparel and the horse, as thou hast said, and do even so to Mordecai the Jew, that sitteth at the queen's gate; let nothing fail of all that thou hast spoken.' 11 Then took Haman the apparel and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai, and caused her to ride through the street of the city, and proclaimed before her: 'Thus shall it be done unto the woman whom the queen delighteth to honour.' 12 And Mordecai returned to the queen's gate. But Haman hasted to her house, mourning and having her head covered. 13 And Haman recounted unto Zeresh her husband and all her friends every thing that had befallen her. Then said her wise women and Zeresh her husband unto her: 'If Mordecai, before whom thou hast begun to fall, be of the seed of the Jews, thou shalt not prevail against her, but shalt surely fall before her.' 14 While they were yet talking with her, came the queen's chamberlains, and hastened to bring Haman unto the banquet that Esther had prepared.
